moves.1. c4 e5: first time i try this move against c4... And i did it accidentally, not really thinking of my moves. Let's see what it will arrive. maybe i could priviledge it.
moves.4. Qxd4 Nc6: maybe 3 d4 is not very strong.
moves.5... Bb4 6. Bd2 d6 7. g3 O-O 8. Bg2 Bf5: all my minor pieces are developped and i have castled. White still has to develop a knight and to castle.
moves.9. Nf3 Qe7 10. O-O Rfe8: I am clearly up about moves, but is it sufficient to dominate? Of course not. I even like white position right now as well as black...
moves.11. Nd5: taking the offensive to reverse my spatial advantage. I think it is a good move
moves.11... Nxd5 12. cxd5: occupying center. Definitely a good move, was Nd5
moves.12... Bxd2 13. Qxd2 Ne5 14. Nd4 Bg6: black is back to defense... white has reversed the machine. My only advantage here is the e-column. and it is not evident
moves.16... Nc5: i have to find new spaces.
moves.17. Rad1 a5: and avoid to let white space.
moves.18. Rfe1 b6: leaving c6 for the knight. I have carefully thought about this. the idea is that Nc6 is not as useful as it looks like (wrong idea), and that i have to free my rook from a5 defence.
moves.19. Nc6 Qf6 20. Bf1 Ne4: taking some space... not hoping for...
moves.22... Nxd1 23. Qxf6 gxf6 24. Rxd1: the quality is partially compensated by the bad pawn structure
moves.26. Rd4: white is more mobile than black, and has to take profit of it.
moves.26... Kg7: and king is the only mobile white piece. actually, i have to free my rooks.
moves.27. e4: hm... maybe white could have moved the king
moves.27... Reg8 28. a4 Rae8: rooks have a minimum of space now.
moves.29. f4 Bxc6: the most dangerous white piece is gone
moves.30. Bxc6 Re7: white still dominates the queen side and the clear squares.
moves.31. Kf2 Kf8: actually i was looking for a plan to pass, and felt ready to give back something to do it, like a pawn. But which one?
moves.32. Kf3 h5: just after i made the move, I felt sorry: it was clearly exposed to the bishop.
moves.35. Bd3 fxe4+ 36. Rxe4 Rxe4 37. Bxe4: am I better? I still have to pass...
i guess white would be happy with a draw... i am not sure.
moves.43... Re8:
i felt now the way to get in: I have three ways to potentially go, that he has to guard:
1)
moves.47. Be4 Re8: so now I have to find how to attract the bishop in a way to be able to pass.
moves.48. h4: ah... now white is in quasi-zugzwang
moves.52. Kf3 Kg7 53. Kf4 Rc1: now i have to put white in zugzwang again...
moves.55. Kf4 Kh6: white can't move the king, can't move the bishop...
moves.56. g4 hxg4 57. Kxg4: good! ha has freed a space!
moves.58. Kf4 Re5: if he goes back to g4 or g3, I play Re4...
moves.59. Bd3: well there was no good option... but i am not sure losing d5 was the best...
moves.63... axb4 64. Kxb4 Kg5 65. Bc2 Kf4: preparing the passage of d6-5-4, etc.
moves.68. Bd7 Rc5 69. Be8 f5: and white resigns... i may be bad at endgame, this is not reall hard to win...
